intro: Commelina nigritana var. gambiae, commonly known as the Gambian spiderwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with diverse ecological roles. The plant features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy blue-violet flowers are typically arranged in clusters and attract various pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
